moves.4... Bg7 5. Nf3 c5: This is the way to play the Pirc if you want to avoid White's Pawn-e5 attack, instead of 0-0.
moves.7... Qa5: ?! This is dubious on my part as well, Operation Bravo Pawn (Lev's & Alex's Pirc term), Black has to initiate his attack and play b5!  No beating-around-the-bush Pirc players.  No twiddling your thumbs, waiting for White to make a mistake, when he already has!
moves.14. Rxf3 Nd7: And here I am, a move short of capturing his c3-Knight winning a Pawn.
moves.15... Bf6: ready to swap Bishop's if 16. Bg5
moves.16. Qh6 Rfe8: The maneuvering of my pieces{'s?} will prevent White's attempt to checkmate my King.
moves.19. Qf4 f6 20. Rg3 Qb4 21. Rb1 a5 22. Qh: !  Foreseeing White's second attack I now plan to walk my King to the Queen-side via f7-e8-d7 or d8.
moves.24. Bxg7 Kxg7 25. Rh3 Kf7: I'd rather flee than try to hold my position.
moves.26. Qg3 a3 27. Qf2 axb2 28. Qxb2 Qd4+ 29: A bit of a lack luster.
